description.narrative: The most significant expected Project-level outcome is expanding the operations of the leading poultry producer in Uganda with positive economy-wide impacts. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that contribution to market creation will be through strengthening the competitiveness of the poultry sector in Uganda through adoption of processing efficiencies and quality control measures that will contribute to greater formalization of the sector. The Project will also contribute to marketing efficiency of the corn and soybean markets by reducing transaction costs, imposing standards, and reducing seasonal price variation by adding storage capacity and purchasing grain and oilseeds at harvest time.

The proposed investment comprises of a convertible C Loan of up to US$5 million and an IDA Private Sector Window (PSW) Loan of up to US$2 million to HMH Rainbow Ltd. (HMH Rainbow or the Company), the leading producer of fresh and frozen chicken in Uganda. The investment supports the Companys US$12 million capacity expansion program comprising of: (i) construction of temperature-controlled broiler houses; (ii) improvement of abattoir operations including the installation of a spin chiller; and (iii) establishment of grain silos and bulk feed-dispatch systems (together, the Project).
